data.title: admin – Page 3 – Templemore Golf Club
data.text:
News up to Sunday 28th July 2019

above photo; Templemore Golf Club Captain Prize Winner 2019, Eoin Fitzpatrick, Templemore. Presentation by Club Captain Tony O’Toole.. also Templemore Golf Club. Lady Captains Prize winner, Sadie Tynan presentation by Lady Captain Lorraine Ryan. (Both Photos by; Seamus Bourke)

Templemore Golf Club News;

Presidents Prize; Friday 26th. and Saturday 27th. Was a fantastic occasion for Joint Club Presidents, Michael Keely and Lady President, Mary Hogan. The weather was excellent, the course was in superb condition which resulted in very high scores. The attendance superseded all expectations. President Michael gave great credit to the course management team and to all the cooperation from everyone which made the occasion very successful. Lady President Mary also reciprocated the same sentiments and especially to the Ladies for all their cooperation in making this a wonderful occasion for the club. The night continued in the ideal location of the Club lounge with music and dance into the early hour. The atmosphere was very enjoyable in what was a continental setting.

President Prize Winner for 2019; Declan Kelly, 45pts. Other Results were; 2nd. Mick Carey 44pts. 3rd. Paul Tuohy 43pts. Best front 9, Jerry Keegan Snr. 22pts. Best Back 9, Jerry Keegan Jnr. 23pts. Best Senior, Liam Daly 22pts. Over 24 Handicap Senior, Phillip Ryan 31pts.

Lady President Prize Winner for 2019; Mary Hayes Kenny, 42pts. Other Results were 2nd. Kay Brennan, 40pts. 3rd. (Gross), Shelia Delaney. 4th. Margie Costigan, 38pts. 5th. Mary Ryan, 38pts. 6th. Past President, Ann O’Rourke, 37pts. 7th. Josie Bourke, 37pts. 1st Nine, Mary Fitzpatrick, 21pts. 2nd. Nine, Kathleen Maher,19pts. Best 30+ Ann Kenny, 32pts.

Fred Perry Trophy; Seanie Gleeson team on Monday 22nd. at 4pm. in Templemore resulted in a great victory -V- West Waterford. The team were; Dennis Maher, Padraigh Moloney, Tom McGrath, Bertie Keane, Seamus Bourke, Liam Daly, Joe O’Connor, Mattie Bourke, Tom Kenny, Joe Fahy, Ambrose Purcell, Michael Purcell, John Hassett. A fantastic result for Templemore to successfully beat such a prestigious club. Well done Seanie and his team.

Sat. 20th. Sun. 21st. 18h S/f Results; 1st. Martin Walsh, 39pts. 2nd. Martin Bohan, 39pts. 3rd. Michael Purcell 35pts.

Central Town Trophy; Templemore-V- Esker hills will be on next Sat. 3rd. Aug. 3 away and 2 Home. The best of Luck to all and Team Manager Liam Leahy.

.

Feileacain Charity Golf Classic; (Remembering Hollie) Saturday 3rd. August, 4ball Stableford,. Players can also play on Friday by arrangement; Contact Declan Russell 085-1846581.. 1st. Prize, 4Ball in Trump Golf resort, Doonbeg. 2nd. 4 Ball in Dromoland Golf Club, 3rd. 4Ball in The Heritage Golf Resort, Killinard. 4th. 4Ball in Shannon Golf Club. Prizes for Non-GUI Golfers; 1st. 4Ball in Nenagh Golf club. 2nd. 4Ball in Rathdowney Golf Club. 3rd. 4Ball in Thurles Golf Club. 4th. 4Ball in Roscrea Golf club. Full support by all Golfers will be appreciated.

Presidents Mixed Social Golf ; The Social Mixed Golf 9 holes was a fantastic success. It will continue every Wednesday Evening, Registration 6. pm . The Presidents Mix Winners for Wed. 24th. 1st. Team; Liam Daly, Shelia Delaney, Mary Butler. 2nd. Team; Cillian Walsh, Kieran Molloy, Marian Keely. 3rd. Team. Joe O’Connor, Garry Russell, Breda O’Carroll.

Seniors Golf; Senior results 18th. July. A huge turnout for the seniors golf. The results were, 1st. John Fitzpatrick, Gerry Keegan, Seamus Ryan, Jim Gleeson. 2nd. Tom Kenny, Michael Maher, Paddy Nolan, Tony O’Toole. 3rd. Tom McGrath, John Brown, Willie Haverty, Pat Maher. The next away Seniors will be on Thursday 16th. as usual.

LMC Seniors Alliance Golf Society; Bernie O’ Rourke still retains 1st position in Golfer of the Year with 283 pts. Also the following Templemore members in the top 10 are: John N Galvin 254Pts. and Bertie Keane 251pts. Well done to all and the best of luck to the finals.

“Cadets” Section; There was a fantastic attendance again at the Cadets on Wed.24th. and Friday 26th. The Cadets age is 8 to 15 Boys and Girls and Cadet youths Age 15 to 18 Boys and Girls. All members who have a junior family member that has an interest in Golf should encourage them to call in on Wed. If new to the game, clubs will be made available to those that do not have them. This is an opportunity to build members for the future of the Club. All training will be in association with CGI (Confederation of Golf Ireland) guidelines and will continue throughout the year. Do your best to promote this venture. A special practice range is now in place for the Cadets. Contact Pat O’ Connell. 087-9205821 Club Juvenile Liaison Officer. Come along if you are interested in playing Golf

Cadet Training; Cadet training for Boys and Girls will continue this wed. 31st.. and Friday 2nd.. Bring a friend, all will be welcomed. Golf Clubs will be available for those that do not have them. Don’t miss this opportunity to start playing Golf.

Constant Reminder that Membership is always Accepted for 2019; There is a constant call out for new members and distance members. You have the option to pay on -line through the club web site by Pay-Pal or Credit Card or by leaving the payment direct to a committee member. The Rates for 2019 are as follows; Gent Membership, €350; Lady Membership, €300; Couple, €500; Country Member, €150; Beginner Gent (Guaranteed not to change for 3 years) €200; Beginner (Lady), (Guaranteed not to change for 3 years) €170; Juvenile (U15), €25; Juniors (15-18yrs. 2nd. Level) €50; Student 3rd. Level & Garda Students, €70; OAP/Clergy (Existing), €230; OAP/Clergy (New), €270; OAP Couple (Existing & New), €350; Unemployed at 1st Jan, €270; Social Welfare Recipients and special needs, €270; Distance (Outside 50K Lady & Gents), €150; Family (Children under 15yrs.), €500; Green Fees (not reduced for 9 holes), €10; Green Fees; Junior, Juvenile, Student and Garda Student, €5;

Special Beginner Rate. Always available is a “Special Fee” for beginners which is guaranteed not to change for 3 years. This is very attractive for anyone new interested in joining and for those purchasing vouchers to give a life changing experience to someone. New members are now been accepted. All current members are encouraged to introduce at least “ONE NEW MEMBER” Lady or Gent, Junior or Student, Seniors Juveniles and Family, Active Retiree’s, Special Needs or any person interested in taking up the sport. It will be a huge advantage to building the club membership and profile.

Welcome back to Lapsed Members; A special rate for “Lapsed Members” will continue throughout the year. A “welcomed back” once-off, special rate for Gents €200 and Ladies €170. This is a great opportunity for golfers, Ladies and Gents who want to return to this great social game.

All current members are encouraged to promote this offer to help those that want to return to the Club. Registrations Forms are now available on-line on our web site, just select the “Membership” tab and it will give you the option to pay by Pay Pal or Credit Card. or collect an application form at the club house or contact Martin Bohan 087 0509278 or any of the committee members. Payment options can also be made through the Golf Club web site link; http://templemoregolfclub.ie/membership/ All will be more than welcomed.

Golf Societies; All golf societies are more than welcome to play the course. For booking dates contact email; mailto:info@templemoregolfclub.ie

Golf can be a Life Changing Gift; Give a life changing Sport experience to someone. The Ideal gift for anyone who would like to take part in an active exercise sport. Golf is that Ideal Gift. Buy a membership Voucher now. Contact Martin Bohan 087 0509278 or any of the committee for to purchase the “Ideal Active Present”.

Active in Retirement; For the active retirement, this is an excellent activity. You will be more than welcome.

Why Join;

Good Outdoor Exercise; 9 holes + 2hrs. 18 Holes = 4hrs.

Good Social occasions, Presentation Nights, Social Mixed, Senior Events and Away Trips.

The Handicap System allows members of different abilities an equal chance of winning.

Various Category of Memberships are available at different rates. ( see Membership rates on our web site).

The club will assist you in starter clubs to get you going. Contact any current member for assistance and you will be looked after.

Donations for Course Development; Donations, sponsorship, will be greatly received and used exclusively for Course Development. Put your stamp on the course making a special contribution. For Donations, Just select the “Membership” tab and then select “Make a Donation” tab on the Club Web Site http://templemoregolfclub.ie/membership/ , or in confidence contact; Martin Bohan 087 0509278. A great thanks to those who have made donations and contributed with sponsorship.

Club Fixtures;

Feileacain Charity Golf Classic; 4ball Stableford, Saturday 3rd. August. Contact Declan Russell 085-1846581. (Remembering Hollie)

Central Towns Trophy. Sat. 3rd Aug.

Diagio Mix. Sunday 11th. Aug. @ 3pm. 2home – 3 Roscrea, Manager Seamus Bourke.

Club Classic Fund Raiser; Date to be confirmed.

White Dowling Society; Saturday October 26.

White Dowling Society; Saturday December 14 .

LMC in Templemore; Monday September 30 (President Phil Ryan Prize)

See Notice Board for more details on club fixtures or contact Club Competition Secretary; Liam Leahy, 087-4115773.

New up to Sunday 21st July

above photo; Templemore Golf Club Ladies Captain Prize Winners. B.R. L -R., Aggie Tobin, Noreen Whelan, Sally Kilcommon, Josie Bourke, Mary Ann Maher, Shelia Delaney, Mary Fitzpatrick, Marjorie Costigan, F.R. L.R. Anne O’Rourke, Lady Captain Lorraine Ryan, Lady President Mary Hogan, Sadie Tynann.

Templemore Golf Club News;

Ladies Golf; -V – K Club. Congratulations to the Ladies on a superb win on Sunday 21st. July against the renowned K-Club Ladies in the Boyne Trophy Competition. The match was played in torrential weather conditions but did now deter the Templemore team ability and determination to win. They battled it out against the K Club ladies with 2wins at home and the final win on the 18th. hole in the K Club. A fantastic victory for Templemore Golf Club Ladies over the very prestigious K Club who won this tournament in 2013 and 2018. The next round is in Edenderry for the Semi-final pre the 19th. Aug. The BOYNE TROPHY competition was the brainchild of Gretta Foran in 1994. It has progressed to be one of the most fiercely contested competitions in the midlands and surrounding areas. The semi-final and final days are hosted by Edenderry Golf Club. The victorious Templemore team were; Mary Ryan, Ann O’Rourke, Mary Hayes, Margee Costigan, Mary Fitztpatrick, Shelia Delaney, Josie Bourke, MaryAnn Maher, Sadie Tynan, Bernie Stapleton. Congratulations to all.

Fred Perry Trophy; Best of luck to Seanie Gleeson team on Monday 22nd. at 4pm. In Templemore. This competition is the “EAST COAST FINAL” -V- West Waterford. Team; Dennis Maher, Padraigh Moloney, Tom McGrath, Bertie Keane, Seamus Bourke, Liam Daly, Joe O’Connor, Mattie Bourke, Tom Kenny, Joe Fahy, Ambrose Purcell, Michael Purcell, John Hassett. (Results in the next Issue)

Presidents Prize; Friday 26th. and Saturday 27th. Club President Michael Keely invites all members to take part in his President Prize Competition with good weather guaranteed and the presentation night in the Club Lounge on Saturday Night 27th. The entry sheet is now available in the locker room and the time sheet draw will be on Wednesday night. Best of luck to all.

Feileacain Charity Golf Classic; Saturday 3rd. August, 4ball Stableford,. Contact Declan Russell 085-1846581. (Remembering Hollie). 1st. Full support by all Golfers will be appreciated.

News up to Sunday 14th July

above photo; Templemore Golf Club Captains Prize Winners. Center, Captain Tony O’Toole. Left. Outright Winner, Eoin Fitzpatrick, Right, Cadet Youths Winner Niall Moloney.

“Templemore Golf Club Captain Prize Winner 2019, Eoin Fitzpatrick, Presentation by Club Captain Tony O’Toole”.

Templemore Golf Club News;

Captains Prize Week; Club Captain Tony O’Toole and Lady Captain Lorrain Ryan had a fantastic response to their Golf week events. The winner of the Captains Prize 2109 was Eoin Fitzpatrick and the winner of the Cadet Youths was Niall Moloney. A talented young winner Eoin Fitzpatrick and Niall Moloney from the Cadets indicates a great future of talented young golfers coming through and an assurance to the future of the Club. The week commence with the Vice-Captain Prize S/F on Saturday 6th. and Sunday 7th. Ladies preliminary round on Tuesday 9th. Social Mix and Vice-Captain Prize Presentation on Wednesday 10th. Seniors on Thursday 11th. Men’s Captain (Stroke Play) preliminary round on Friday 12th. Men’s semi-final and Ladies Final on Saturday 13th. Men’s Captain final on Sunday 14th. There was a joint presentation in the Club Lounge on Sunday evening 15th. The weather was fantastic, and the Club Lounge was alive and vibrant with a continental atmosphere due to the excellent weather, relaxation on the balconies to a full moon. A BRILLANT Night.

Captains Mixed Social Golf ; The Social Mixed Golf 9 holes is continuing in full swing every Wednesday Evening, Registration 6.30pm . Winners for Wed. 10th. 1st. Team; Declan Kennedy, Jim Kennedy, Breda Murphy. 2nd. Team; Mick Keely, Niall Bourke, Mary Hayes. 3rd Team. Tom McGrath, Mick Carey, Mary Butler.

Captains Seniors Golf; Senior results 11th. July. A huge turnout for the Captains senior golf. The results were, 1st. Ambrose Purcell, Pascal Whelan, P,O’Connell, Seanie Gleeson. 2nd. George Collins, Jerry Keegan, John Galvin. 3rd. John Hassett, Phil Ryan, Mick Connell, Tom Hogan.. The next away Seniors will be on Monday 15th. in Rathdowney, and Thursday 16th. as usual.

Fred Perry Trophy; Change to competition date; Seanie’s team is now into the “EAST COAST FINAL” -V- West Waterford on Monday 22nd. July at 4pm. In Templemore.

Cadet Youth Competition; There was a 9hole competition for Cadet Youths (15-18) on Thursday 11th. at 6.30 pm. Under the supervision of Youth Manager Dinny Touhy and assistant Manager Sean Lee. The winners were; .1st. Niall Moloney, 2nd. Luke Ormond, 3rd. Dylan Carey. A fantastic performance by all and an indication that the club future is looking promising.

“Cadets” Section; There was a fantastic attendance at the Cadets on Wed.10th. age 8 to 15 Boys and Girls and youths Age 15 to 18 Boys and Girls. News up to Sunday 8th July 2019

above photo; Templemore Golf Club, Fred Perry victorious team over Dungarvin in Templemore on Monday 1st. July. The Team; B.R. Seamus Bourke, Mattie Bourke, John Hassett, Padraig Moloney, Joe O’Connor, Dennis Maher. F.R. Seanie Gleeson Manager, Tom McGrath, Bertie Keane, Liam Daly, Michael Purcell, Joe Fahy.

Templemore Golf Club News;

Captains Prize Week; Best of luck to Club Captain Tony O’Toole and Lady Captain Lorrain Ryan on this special week of Captains Golf events. The week will commence with the Vice-Captain Prize S/F on Saturday 6th. and Sunday 7th. Ladies preliminary round on Tuesday 9th. Social Mix and Vice-Captain Prize Presentation on Wednesday 10th. Seniors on Thursday 11th. Men’s Captain (Stroke Play) preliminary round on Friday 12th. Men’s semi-final and Ladies Final on Saturday 13th. Men’s Captain final on Sunday 14th. There will be joint presentations in the Club Lounge Sunday evening. A great week of golf activity to be enjoyed by all. (Results in next Issue)

Vice-Captain Prize; Congratulation to Vice Captain Dennis Maher on a successful weekend of golf and his appreciation to the great turn out on what was a glorious weekend of Golf. Well done Dennis. (Results below)

Results Vice Captains Prize were.

1st. P.J. Leahy 41pts. 2nd. Joey o Dwyer 41 pts. 3rd. Ml Carey 40 pts. 4th. D. Kennedy 39 pts. 0_11 P Dunne. 12_18 Ml Keely. 18+ Martin Walsh.

Congrats to all and well done to all who played . Great turnout. Total of 55 played. Presentation of prizes wednesday evening 10th. at social mixed. Hope all who featured can attend, Thanks to all Vice Captain Dinny Maher.

Fred Perry Trophy; Congratulations to Seanie Gleeson and his victorious team who beat Dungarvin in Templemore on Monday 1st. July. Seanie’s team is now into the “EAST COAST FINAL” -V- West Waterford on Tuesday 16th. July at 4pm. In Templemore. All available support on the 16th. will be appreciated. Another fantastic achievement for Templemore Golf Club. The Team; Seamus Bourke, Mattie Bourke, John Hassett, Padraig Moloney, Joe O’Connor, Dennis Maher. Seanie Gleeson Manager, Tom McGrath, Bertie Keane, Liam Daly, Michael Purcell, Joe Fahy.

Central Towns Trophy: Another great victory by Liam Leahy winning formula team -v- Birr, home and away on Saturday 6th. Another brilliant performance for the Club. The tournament is organised and run by Tullamore Golf Club and the Trophy, which is perpetual, is known as the “Central Towns Trophy”.

Boyne Trophy; Congratulations to the Ladies in their victory -V- Baltinglass on Sunday 7th. Another proud achievement for Templemore Golf Club. A Super victory. The BOYNE TROPHY competition was the brainchild of the esteemed Gretta Foran in 1994, designed to cater for the “over 50’s” ladies, it has progressed to be one of the most fiercely contested competitions in the midlands and surrounding areas.

Week-end Competition; Results 18hole stableford Sat. 29th. & Sun. 30th. June; 1st. Ambrose Purcell 37pts. 2nd. Andy Purcell 36pts. 3rd. Brendan Russell 35pts. Top 16 scores for McHugh Cup are; Ambrose Purcell, Andy Purcell, Brendan Russell, Patrick Cadell, Michael Keely, Bertie Keane, Ciaran Hassett, Paul Touhy, Seamus Bourke, Jerry Keegan, Michael Walsh, Michael Purcell, Michael Carey, Donal Hayes, John Greed, John Hassett. Best of Luck to all.

Saturdays & Sundays Week-End Competition; The 18hole Stableford on Saturdays and Sundays is now in full motion. The course is in excellent condition, so great scores are expected. Link up with other available players by using the Club “WhatsApp”

Mixed Social Golf ; The Social Mixed Golf 9 holes is continuing in full swing every Wednesday Evening, Registration 6.30pm . Winners for Wed. 3rd. 1st. Team; Ambrose Purcell, Niall Bourke, Sally Kilcommon. 2nd. Team; Tony O’Toole, Seamus Bourke, Joe O Dwyer.

Seniors Golf; Senior results 4th. July. Another excellent turnout for the senior golf. The results were, 1st. John Hassett, Joe Hennessy, Willie Haverty, Pat O’Connell . 2nd. Ambrose Purcell, Mick Connell, Eddie Butler, James Murray. 3rd. Paudie Butler, Pascall Whelan, PJ Leahy. Tony O’Toole. The next Seniors will be on Captains Week Thursday 11th. at 10am.

News up to sunday 9th June 2019

above photo; Templemore Golf Club Central Towns Home Winning Team. Mick Keely Templemore, Donal Scally Castle Barna, Padraigh Moloney Templemore, Chris Merrigan Castle Barna.

Templemore Golf Club News;

Another Great Victory for Templemore; Central Towns Trophy, 2nd Round. Home Team Mick Keely, Padraig Moloney. Away team, Joe O’Connor, Tom McGrath, Dinny Maher, Team Manager, Liam Leahy overwhelm beat Castle Barna who won the event in 2011, also Templemore beat in the 1st. Round, Portumna who won the event 5 Times, last time in 2018. 3rd. round date TBC. The Central Towns Trophy was inaugurated by Tullamore Golf Club in 1965. It’s a hugely popular competition. The format is five singles match-play off scratch for 13 handicap and upwards on a home and away basis. Congratulations to the Templemore Team and may their success continue with the next rounds.

Ladies Golf; Another Great Victory for Templemore. The Templemore Boyne ladies team had a tremendous victory Sunday 9th. -V- Mount Wolsely. This completes the 2nd round and the 3rd. round will be in early July . The BOYNE TROPHY competition was the brainchild of our esteemed member Gretta Foran in 1994, designed to cater for the “over 50’s” ladies it has progressed to be one of the most fiercely contested competitions in the midlands and surrounding areas. Teams consist of five pairs of ladies who compete under fourball match play rules. Round 3, The semi-final and final days are hosted by Edenderry Golf Club. Congratulations to all the Templemore Ladies and may their success continue with the next rounds.

above photo; Templemore Golf Club Seniors, Presenting a Substantial Donation towards the recent purchase of essential new equipment by Chairman PJ Leahy and treasurer Philip Ryan to Club Captain Tony O’Toole.

Templemore Golf Club News;

Seniors Donation; A special thanks to all the Templemore Golf Club Seniors for their substantial donation to the club towards the recent purchase of new equipment. The Seniors are an integral part of Templemore Golf Club. The Seniors were initiated by Philip Ryan in 2012 and supported by Pat Costello and Rody Cawley. The competition formula was mentored by Rody Cawley which is still in use and standing the test of time and contributes to a friendly inclusive game of golf. The Social aspect, the banter, sharing of stories, presentation of prizes, the cup of tea and sandwich are all vital parts to a very enjoyable day of golf. The seniors are held every Thursday at 10am. For a 9holes scramble which only cost €5 for the day plus an annual fee of €5. The seniors also arrange 4/5 outings a year to renowned 18h Golf Club at special affordable rates. All surplus funds are passed onto the Club towards the development and maintenance of the course. Several contributions were made to the club since 2012. The seniors are very conscious of the gift of having such an open and friendly Golf Club that appreciates its senior members. New seniors over 55 are always welcome and especially from other clubs and freelance members. Current Committee are; Chairman, PJ Leahy, Secretary, Pat O’Connell, Treasurer, Philip Ryan. Sean Lee, John Galvin, Rody Cawley, John Stapleton.

Fred Perry Trophy; Another great victory by Seanie Gleeson in the Fred Perry Trophy; Round 2, on Tuesday 28 -V- Ballykisteen. Well done to all the team. Another proud victory for the club..

Templemore Golf Club News;

Condolences;

Condolences expressed to John Stapleton and family on the sad passing of their daughter Amanda in the UK on Monday 6th. Funeral arrangements to be finalized.

Condolences also expressed to Dinny Ryan and family on the sad passing of their son John on Thursday 9th. The Ryan family have been involved with Templemore Golf Club for many years. John’s father Dinny has represented the club on various teams, his grandad Jimmy Snr. was a past President, and his uncle Jim is our current Handicap Secretary. Our thoughts and prayers are with his parents Dinny and Patricia, his brothers James, Daniel and Donncha, grandparents and extended family and friends. Burial took place in St. Brigid’s Cemetery on Mon. 13th.

JB Carr Competition; After the recent victory over Tipperary Town, the team traveled to meet Ballykisteen Golf Club on Tuesday 7th. at 3pm. Luck did not prevail on the day. Ballykisteen were the better side. We we’re beaten 4.1. Well done to everyone in representing our Club. The result was not ours this time. Last year was special victory. Let’s look forward again to more victories.

“Cadet” Section; Collective vetting will take place this week. “Garda Vetting application Forms” have been circulated and are also available in the locker rooms. All members Ladies and Gents who want to be involved in this great project for the future of the club will have to complete a “Vetting Form” it would be fantastic if, as many as possible would support the development of the Cadet sector in our club under the guidance of CGI, (Confederation of Golf Ireland). Completed form can be placed in the “FEE” box in the locker room or contact Pat O’ Connell. 087-9205821 Club Juvenile Liaison Officer.

Club Survey; A “Club Survey” form to complete will be issued shortly. Your input to this project is giving each member Ladies and Gents an opportunity to “having your say “ on the future development of the club. This Survey will be analyzed under the guidance of CGI, (Confederation of Golf Ireland) for more information contact Club Secretary, Pat O’ Connell. 087-9205821
